{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3561214,"name":"Lincoln","username":"Lincoln-M","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/l/e480ec/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-18T22:41:50.095Z","cooked":"

With the competition fast approaching, we are starting to panic. We have been trying to make the phoenix 6 library function on our robot, but it refuses to do so. after robotpy deploy, and saying yes to the uninstall and reinstall, we get an error saying that phoenix6 needs to be version 25.1.0 not 25.3.1. We have uninstalled phoenix6 v25.3.1, and then manually installed version 25.1.0. This still throws the error even though v25.1.0 is the version installed.

Edit: We were continuing to look through the code, and noticed that other than wpilib and basic things such as math, nothing was getting properly imported. the module itself was getting imported, but other than that, all function and constants weren’t accessible. phoenix6 though, doesn’t have this issue.

Any ideas on what we may have done or may be missing would be a life saver.

Remove phoenix from robotpy-extras and add it explicitly to requires instead.

Or wait for robotpy 2025.3.2.0 to come out, hopefully later tonight?

adding phoenix6 to requires instead seems to have done the trick. any ideas on why other module imports just dont work? in our case, we are using rev.
